meanings.definition: In an oblate manner; flattened at the poles.
meanings.sent1: The Earth bulges oblatly at the equator.
meanings.sent2: The pancake was cooked oblatly, making it thin and wide.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to roll oblatly like a ball, but it ended up looking funny.
meanings.sent4: Her smile spread oblatly across her face, brightening the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the sky oblatly, creating a beautiful horizon.

meanings.definition: Having a flattened shape; wider than it is tall.
meanings.sent1: The oblatly shaped table fit perfectly in the corner.
meanings.sent2: The oblatly cake was easy to slice into even pieces.
meanings.sent3: The oblatly hat made him look like a mushroom, much to his friends' amusement.
meanings.sent4: The oblatly shadow of the tree stretched across the lawn.
meanings.sent5: The oblatly building stood out among the tall skyscrapers.
